content: Is there a way to link to the contact form and to pre-select the category?

Hi @Kevin Golding I guess, you're looking for the default category setting:

screenshot-cat-selected.png
I think @Kevin Golding wants to have multiple categories, and link to one that's not the default...
Thanks, but Peter is right - I have six categories and ideal want to set the category depending on the page they clicked from.
The WIP site is https://1sttatts.kgolding.co.uk/ and I want to link to the contact form for each of the "Sections".
I am already using Webform on the site, and I think this supports pre-filling so I'll explore that as an option

I see...
As far as I know, there's no simple solution for that in the contact module. Either do some coding (hook_form_alter()), or use webform instead... Or am I missing something?
Looks like Backdrop's Webform doesn't have the "Allow elements to be populated using query string parameters" feature - so back to the drawing board.
I suppose I could just create a separate Webform for each section?
The plot thickens... looks like Webform support tokens in the default value using "[current-page:query:?]" :)

Hey @Kevin Golding :wave: ...looks like you'd either need to raise an issue agains the Webform module in https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/webform/issues or alternatively use https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/prepopulate

backdrop-contrib/webform
For making surveys and forms in Backdrop. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/webform development by creating an account on GitHub.
backdrop-contrib/prepopulate
Allows fields in most forms to be pre-populated from the $_REQUEST variable. - backdrop-contrib/prepopulate
Thanks @klonos I think I'm going to go for a separate webform for each of the four sections, which will let me add custom fields per section as well.
Yup, Webform is the recommended way if you need more elaborate functionality for your contact forms :+1: The core Contact module is only for the most simplistic use case.
Ha, didn't realise Prepopulate was ported to Backdrop already! :smiley:
@Kevin Golding I'm pretty sure Webform does have that feature. It should work the same way it does in Drupal 7
If you're having trouble let me know
@Herb Thanks for the offer, but I have sorted it now, and yes webform can have fields preset using tokens in the default values including a query token.
